prompt:
Nurse: That's good to hear. You will need to stop any supplements or anti-diarrheal medications before your colonoscopy. Do you have any questions about this?

Patient: No. No.

Nurse: Alright. I'd like to move onto the instructions for the clear liquid diet and NuLYTELY laxative solution. This is often the hardest part of the prep. How are you feeling about it?

Patient: No.

Nurse: I understand that it's not something you're looking forward to. Most people say the procedure itself is no problem at all but the bowel prep can be a bit tough. But we're here to support you every step of the way. Do you

Patient: Jesus Christ. I want to get it over with.

Nurse: I can understand that it's not something you're looking forward to. Most people say the procedure itself is no problem at all, but the bowel prep can be a bit tough. We're here to support you every step of the way. Do you have any questions about this part of the prep?

Patient: I have no questions.

responses.gpt4: Alright. For your clear liquid diet, you don't have to do anything just yet. But you'll need to start it 24 hours before your procedure by drinking only clear liquids. This involves no solid food and you can drink any clear or light colored beverages without red or purple dye. Can I share some examples of what clear liquids are, and then you can tell me if you have any questions?
responses.our_model: Alright. You don't have to do anything just yet. But you'll need to start your bowel prep 24 hours before your procedure by drinking only clear liquids. This involves no solid foods and drinking either clear or light colored beverages without any red or purple dye. Can I share some examples of what clear liquids are?
